title: Confusing error messages when a pattern match contains .foo() expressions

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code

```Rust
#[derive(Debug, PartialEq)]
enum Pet {
    Dog(String),
}

fn main() {
    let d = Pet::Dog("fido".to_string());

    // Intended.
    assert_eq!(d, Pet::Dog("fido".to_string()));

    // What I wrote by accident.
    assert!(matches!(d, Pet::Dog("fido".to_string())));
}
```

### Current output

```Shell
error: expected one of `)`, `,`, `...`, `..=`, `..`, or `|`, found `.`
  --> src/main.rs:14:40
   |
14 |     assert!(matches!(d, Pet::Dog("fido".to_string())));
   |                                        ^
   |                                        |
   |                                        expected one of `)`, `,`, `...`, `..=`, `..`, or `|`
   |                                        help: missing `,`

error[E0531]: cannot find tuple struct or tuple variant `to_string` in this scope
  --> src/main.rs:14:41
   |
14 |     assert!(matches!(d, Pet::Dog("fido".to_string())));
   |                                         ^^^^^^^^^ not found in this scope

error[E0023]: this pattern has 2 fields, but the corresponding tuple variant has 1 field
  --> src/main.rs:14:34
   |
3  |     Dog(String),
   |         ------ tuple variant has 1 field
...
14 |     assert!(matches!(d, Pet::Dog("fido".to_string())));
   |                                  ^^^^^^ ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected 1 field, found 2
```

### Desired output

_No response_

### Rationale and extra context

The third message is really confusing: I think rustc has assumed I intended `"fido", to_string()`? It's surprising to see an error talk about a field with two patterns.

### Other cases

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_
